Sentencas: Thermodynamic equilibrium of ethanol partial oxidation has been studied by Gibbs free energy minimization method for hydrogen production in the range of oxygen-to-ethanol molar ratio from 0 to 3, reaction temperature from 500 to 1400 K, pressure from 1 to 20 atm and nitrogen-to-ethanol molar ratio from 0 to 100.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of hydrogen production via partial oxidation of ethanol

Sentencas: The optimal operation conditions were obtained, which are 1070-1200 K, oxygen-to-ethanol molar ratio of 0.6-0.8, and 1 atm.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of hydrogen production via partial oxidation of ethanol

Sentencas: Under the optimal conditions, complete conversion of ethanol, 86.28-94.98% yield of hydrogen and 34.69-38.64% concentration of carbon monoxide could be achieved and at which no coke tends to form.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of hydrogen production via partial oxidation of ethanol

Sentencas: The hydrogen-rich fuel obtained is suitable for the use in Molten Carbonate Fuel Cell and Solid Oxide Fuel Cell.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of hydrogen production via partial oxidation of ethanol

Sentencas: Higher pressures have a negative effect on the hydrogen yield.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of hydrogen production via partial oxidation of ethanol

Sentencas: Inert gases have a negative effect on the hydrogen yield at low nitrogen-to-ethanol molar ratios (below 40), but further increasing the concentrations of the inert gases increases the hydrogen yield slightly.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of hydrogen production via partial oxidation of ethanol

Sentencas: Coke tends to form at lower temperatures and lower oxygen-to-ethanol molar ratios, (C) 2008 International Association for Hydrogen Energy.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of hydrogen production via partial oxidation of ethanol
Thermodynamic analysis of hydrogen production via partial oxidation of ethanol
